constituent: complete, child with arms wrapped up
heisigStory: Learn this character by returning to frame 99 and the image given there. The only difference is that the "arms" have been left off (actually, only tucked inside). Thus a child with its arms wrapped up into the back-sack is the picture of a job successfully completed.
koohiiStory1: The experiment was a complete failure! The child was made without any arms!
koohiiStory2: A child with the arms inside the blanket will be completely wrapped up.
words: comprehension, consent, understanding, roger (on the radio)
acknowledgement, understanding (e.g. "please be understanding of the mess during our renovation")
